column4: Just tried to apt-get install the flashplugin-installer from the Ubuntu repos.  The .deb downloaded fine, but then during the config stage it gave a 404 error when it tried to download the actual plugin.  Anyone know what's going on?
try using the software center and installing the free community flash plug in
The thing is that I want the actual Adobe plugin, and clearly something with the ubuntu package is fubar.
I can probably download directly from adobe and install, but I'd much prefer to know what's going on with the official package.
What's weird is that a quick search didn't turn up any recent references to such a phenomenon.
haha
did you reproduce it with apt-get autoremove
I don't think you can do it on the fly.
Regarding the flash thing, oddly if I try their code to reproduce it something else happens.  It then appears to install without errors, though flash doesn't actually work.
Trying to figure out how I determine whent he mirror was last updated.  I guess I can probably look at the mod time for the packages file.
What's even MORE bizarre about that is that flashplugin-nonfree is a transitional package, and I thought all it really goes is install flashplugin-installer, which is what I'd been doing.
you tried the apt-update they told you to I am assuming?
did you enable the restricted repo in sources
I did update.  But in any case I've updated apt far more recently than those bug posts.  restricted repo must be enabled otherwise it wouldn't find the package at all, right?
yea I guess so
I think I got to the bottom of the issue.
The mirror I was using seems to be out of date.
When I set it to use the main US mirror everything works out.
you changed the mirriors around? or do you not live in the US
I changed mirrors to one that I get much faster speeds to.
But it appears that mirror is out of date.
